description.narrative: The Climate Aggregation Platform (CAP) will promote the scale-up of financial aggregation for small-scale, low-carbon energy assets in developing countries.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Indicator: Direct impact: USD value of financially closed CAP showcase transactions
Indicator: Direct impact: Lifetime GHG emission reductions from financially closed CAP showcase transactions
Indicator: Direct impact: number of individuals or businesses benefiting from low-carbon energy as a result of financially closed CAP showcase transactions. Disaggregated by gender.
Indicator: Survey score conveying stakeholders’ assessment of CAP’s awareness raising
Indicator: Survey score conveying stakeholders’ assessment of CAP’s global knowledge products
Indicator: CAP global working group meetings
Indicator: Financially closed CAP showcase transactions
Indicator: CAP national working groups
Indicator: Endorsement letters by relevant stakeholders conveying positive assessment of impact of CAP’s market development activities

comment.narrative:
Indicator: Direct impact: USD value of financially closed CAP showcase transactions - Baseline: 0 CAP showcase transactions
Indicator: Direct impact: Lifetime GHG emission reductions from financially closed CAP showcase transactions - Baseline: 0 CAP showcase transactions
Indicator: Direct impact: number of individuals or businesses benefiting from low-carbon energy as a result of financially closed CAP showcase transactions. Disaggregated by gender - Baseline: 0 CAP showcase transactions
Indicator: Survey score conveying stakeholders’ assessment of CAP’s awareness raising - Baseline: 0 CAP awareness raising activities
Indicator: Survey score conveying stakeholders’ assessment of CAP’s global knowledge products - Baseline: 0 CAP global knowledge products
Indicator: CAP global working group meetings - Baseline: Baseline: 0 meetings annually
Indicator: Financially closed CAP showcase transactions - 0 CAP showcase transactions
Indicator: CAP national working groups - Baseline: 0 meetings annually
Indicator: Endorsement letters by relevant stakeholders conveying positive assessment of impact of CAP’s market development activities - Baseline: 0 CAP market development activities

Project Objective: To promote the scale-up of financial aggregation for small-scale, low-carbon energy assets in developing countries
Indicator 1: Direct impact: USD value of financially closed CAP showcase transactions End of Project target: USD 30 million
Indicator 2: Direct impact: Lifetime GHG emission reductions from financially closed CAP showcase transactions End of Project target: 266,118 tC02e1
Indicator 3: Direct impact: number of individuals or businesses benefiting from low-carbon energy as a result of financially closed CAP showcase transactions. Disaggregated by gender. End of Project target: 31,250 individuals, of which 15,625 are women or 60 businesses1
1.Project objective targets presented here are based on assumptions. Showcase transactions for each in-country initiative will only be identified later during project implementation. This will determine the size of transactions, low-carbon technology types and associated baseline technologies. Beneficiaries will also be a function of the low-carbon technology type. The USD 30 million project target shown in the table is for a total of 3 showcase transactions, with a conservative assumption that each transaction amounts to an average USD 10m in size. The tC02e target used here is based on a number of assumptions, including a solar PV technology and a combined cycle gas baseline. The individual or business beneficiaries assumes average household rooftop solar PV systems of 3kW, and average C&I rooftop solar PV systems of USD 500,000 per system. Average household size of 5 individuals. All of these estimates will be replaced with empirical data during project implementation. Sources: IRENA, Power to Change (2016); UNDP, DREI Tunisia (2014).
Component/Outcome 1: Increased awareness, exchange of information and engagement in financial aggregation for small-scale, low-carbon energy activities in developing countries.
Indicator 1: Survey score conveying stakeholders’ assessment of CAP’s awareness raising End of Project target: 75% of stakeholders state ‘satisfied’ or ‘very satisfied’
Indicator 2: Survey score conveying stakeholders’ assessment of CAP’s global knowledge products End of Project target: 75% of stakeholders state ‘satisfied’ or ‘very satisfied’
Indicator3: CAP global working group meetings Target: 4 well-attended meetings held annually
Component/ Outcome 2: Financial closure of three financial aggregation transactions for small-scale, low carbon energy activities in developing countries Indicator 1: Financially closed CAP showcase transactions End of Project target: 4 showcase transactions supported
Component/ Outcome 3: The market architecture and environment for replication and scale-up of financial aggregation transactions for small-scale, low-carbon energy is enhanced in three developing countries
Indicator 1: CAP national working groups Target: 4 well-attended meetings held annually in each in-country initiative
Indicator 2: Endorsement letters by relevant stakeholders conveying positive assessment of impact of CAP’s market development activities Target: 3 endorsement letters in each in-country initiative
